intro: Gyrostachys dilatata, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, ovate leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Gyrostachys dilatata is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
